Submodules¶

qstack.compound module¶

Module containing all the operations to load, transform, and save molecular objects.

qstack.compound.fragment_partitioning(fragments, prop_atom_inp, normalize=True)¶

Computes the contribution of each fragment.

Parameters:

  • fragments (numpy ndarray) – Fragment definition

  • prop_atom_inp (list of arrays or array) – Coefficients densities.

  • normalize (bool) – Normalized fragment partitioning. Defaults to True.

Returns:

A list of arrays or an array containing the contribution of each fragment.

qstack.compound.fragments_read(frag_file)¶

Loads fragement definition from a frag file.

Parameters:

frag_file (str) – Name (including path) of the frag file to read.

Returns:

A list of arrays containing the fragments.

qstack.compound.gmol_to_mol(fin, basis='def2-svp')¶

Reads a molecular file in gmol format and returns a pyscf Mole object.

Parameters:

  • fin (str) – Name (including path) of the xyz file to read.

  • basis (str or dict) – Basis set.

  • charge (int) – Charge of the molecule.

  • spin (int) – Alpha electrons - beta electrons.

Returns:

pyscf Mole object.

Return type:

pyscf Mole

qstack.compound.make_auxmol(mol, basis)¶

Builds an auxiliary Mole object given a basis set and a pyscf Mole object.

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – Original pyscf Mole object.

  • basis (str or dict) – Basis set.

Returns:

An auxiliary pyscf Mole object.

qstack.compound.mol_to_xyz(mol, fout, format='xyz')¶

Converts a pyscf Mole object into a molecular file in xyz format.

Parameters:

  • Mole (pyscf) – pyscf Mole object.

  • fout (str) – Name (including path) of the xyz file to write.

Returns:

A file in xyz format containing the charge, total spin and molecular coordinates.

qstack.compound.rotate_molecule(mol, a, b, g, rad=False)¶

Rotate a molecule: transform nuclear coordinates given a set of Euler angles.

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – Original pyscf Mole object.

  • a (float) – Alpha Euler angle.

  • b (float) – Beta Euler angle.

  • g (float) – Gamma Euler angle.

  • rad (bool) – Wheter the angles are in radians or not.

Returns:

A pyscf Mole object with transformed coordinates.

qstack.compound.xyz_to_mol(fin, basis='def2-svp', charge=0, spin=0)¶

Reads a molecular file in xyz format and returns a pyscf Mole object.

Parameters:

  • fin (str) – Name (including path) of the xyz file to read.

  • basis (str or dict) – Basis set.

  • charge (int) – Charge of the molecule.

  • spin (int) – Spin of the molecule (alpha electrons - beta electrons).

Returns:

A pyscf Mole object containing the molecule information.

qstack.constants module¶

NIST physical constants and unit conversion

https://physics.nist.gov/cuu/Constants/ https://physics.nist.gov/cuu/Constants/Table/allascii.txt

qstack.equio module¶

qstack.equio.array_to_tensormap(mol, v)¶

Transform an array into a tensor map.

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

  • v (numpy ndarray) – Array. It can be a vector or a matrix.

Returns:

A equistore tensor map.

qstack.equio.join(tensors)¶

Merge two or more tensors with the same label names avoiding information duplictaion.

Parameters:

tensors (list) – List of equistore TensorMap.

Returns:

A equistore TensorMap containing the information of all the input tensors.

qstack.equio.matrix_to_tensormap(mol, dm)¶

Transform a matrix into a tensor map. Used by array_to_tensormap().

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

  • v (numpy ndarray) – Matrix.

Returns:

A equistore tensor map.

qstack.equio.split(tensor)¶

Split a tensor based on the molecule information stored within the input TensorMap.

Parameters:

tensor (equistore TensorMap) – Tensor containing several molecules.

Returns:

N equistore TensorMap, where N is equal to the total number of diferent molecules stored within the input TensorMap.

qstack.equio.tensormap_to_array(mol, tensor)¶

Transform a tensor map into an array.

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

  • tensor (equistore TensorMap) – Tensor.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray. Matrix or vector, depending on the key names of the tensor.

qstack.equio.tensormap_to_matrix(mol, tensor)¶

Transform a tensor map into a matrix. Used by tensormap_to_array().

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

  • tensor (equistore TensorMap) – Tensor.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray (matrix).

qstack.equio.tensormap_to_vector(mol, tensor)¶

Transform a tensor map into a vector. Used by tensormap_to_array().

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

  • tensor (equistore TensorMap) – Tensor.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray (vector).

qstack.equio.vector_to_tensormap(mol, c)¶

Transform a vector into a tensor map. Used by array_to_tensormap().

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

  • v (numpy ndarray) – Vector.

Returns:

A equistore tensor map.

qstack.tools module¶

qstack.tools.correct_num_threads()¶
qstack.tools.gpr2pyscf(mol, vector)¶

Reorder p-orbitals from -1,0,+1 (SA-GPR convention) to +1,-1,0 (pyscf convention).

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

  • vector (numpy ndarray) – Vector or a matrix of atomic orbitals ordered in pyscf convention.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray with the reordered vector or matrix.

qstack.tools.pyscf2gpr(mol, vector)¶

Reorder p-orbitals from +1,-1,0 (pyscf convention) to -1,0,+1 (SA-GPR convention).

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf Mole) – pyscf Mole object.

  • vector (numpy ndarray) – Vector or a matrix of atomic orbitals ordered in pyscf convention.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray with the reordered vector or matrix.

qstack.tools.rotate_euler(a, b, g, rad=False)¶

Computes the rotation matrix given Euler angles.

Parameters:

  • a (float) – Alpha Euler angle.

  • b (float) – Beta Euler angle.

  • g (float) – Gamma Euler angle.

  • rad (bool) – Wheter the angles are in radians or not.

Returns:

A 2D numpy ndarray with the rotation matrix.

qstack.tools.unix_time_decorator(func)¶
